page.title: 19FOOTPATHS CHANGING
page.content: We visited{Southall Farm}where we saw how the footpaths have altered. One footpath goes through a farmyard, the other goes through a field, in both cases the farmer is not happy. The proposed footpath changes are that the paths will cross south of Southall Farm.The one path will cross a stream, here youngsters are on a Y.T.S scheme have built a new bridge. The other footpath that used to cross a field will now follow a field boundry and then follow the stream path to Doverdale and in the other direction to Hadley. There is also a bridle way for horses, Hadley to Doverdale. {MR Bayliss}a parish council, lived at Comhampton. When he was a boy he used to walk from his home through {Sytchampton}to Doverdale church. There was only one field between Sytchampton and Doverdale called Cow Pastures.
